title: Agbe
author: Agbe
created_time: October 24, 2022, 11:49:08 AMLast edit: October 25, 2022, 10:22:01 PM by Agbe
content: Nigerian Flood VictimNigeria was flooded from the month of September 2022. The flood started from the Northern part of the country and the month of October 2022 the flood sank thousands of houses in the southern part of the country. Particular my home state (Bayelsa) which is highly affected more than any other parts in the country. Deeply AffectedSo as a flood victim in the forum, I am asking to know if it is wrong to ask for the support from the forum users. Or will the community go against if I asked for the support from the community in this situation? I am asking because I am deeply affected by the flood. I have lost properties, though I raised up  some of the properties because there was no vehicle movement to pack the things so I left them there, and lodged in a hotel and since no one was around in the compound, arm robbers came in and stole my valuable properties. As it is I am out of funds.High cost of LivingThe road that was connected the East and South has been broken into three parts so no fuel and food stuff comes in so the people who sells at the region increase the prices of goods and services x5. Fuel that was sold at the rate of $0.39 per litre is now $1.9 and fuel price determine any other goods prices in the country.https://floodlist.com/africa/nigeria-floods-bayelsa-october-2022My compound MeMy room the flood is going down now.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: You don't have to worry about flood relief in Nigeria, good news Nigeria: Aid beginning to trickle in for flood victims, plus a few more dollars for flood victims in Nigeria, through IFAD announces $5m grant to assist flood victims in Nigeria, and also includes US provides $1 million support for flood victims in Nigeria & Nigeria: Floods displace 1.4 M, federal govt starts delivery of relief supply, Nigeria is currently flooded with aid from various parties, who want to help flood victims there.There is nothing wrong with someone who wants to convey humanitarian complaints and information in this forum, as you do for flood victims.The problem here is 'honesty', not accusing and not disbelieving, what is clear is that we are tired of the drama of donations that have been done by some members here, for donations to be voluntary, all decisions are in the hands of members who want to donate.
